forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. North northwest wind 3 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 13 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun dips below the horizon tonight, Downtown San Francisco embraces a sense of quiet coolness, tempered by partly cloudy skies that hint at the remnants of the day. The temperature lingers around a crisp 45 degrees, coaxing a gentle north-northwest breeze that carries with it whispers of the bay, occasionally raising playful gusts to 23 mph. The city seems to shimmer, inhabitants glancing upwards at a canvas of soft grays and pastels, the clouds in an amicable dance with the fading light. 

Looking ahead to Tuesday, expect a transition from the peaceful twilight into a morning touched by warmth, partly sunny with highs nearing 58 and gently drifting to 55 by afternoon. The air, infused with a hint of maritime influence, beckons for layers—a cozy sweater worn beneath a light jacket would serve well against the lingering chill. With the promise of better clarity in the day, it’s an ideal time to stroll along the waterfront or explore the quaint corners of the Mission district, perhaps pausing for a steaming cup of coffee at a local café while savoring the hustle of life in this vibrant city. The playful nature of the wind suggests an afternoon walk or engaging with friends outdoors, as the city bikes through its unique rhythms, bringing a calm yet invigorating charm to one’s day.
